fields.description:
Nex Gen Project View: Subtasks should be included in the Roadmap view.

Current Issue: Next Gen Roadmap does not show Stories, Tasks, and sub-tasks.
fields.summary: Nex Gen Project View : Stories, Tasks, and Subtasks should be included in Roadmap view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you copy/ paste or even just highlight the image from a previous comment on an issue and paste it on a new comment fails to show after you refresh the browser.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a screenshot and paste into a new comment
 # Copy or highlight the same image to paste in a different new comment box
 # Refresh the browser and the image will fail to load

h3. Expected Results

Should show the image in the new comment even if you use an existing image from previous comments on the same issue

h3. Actual Results

Showing error message *Unable to render embedded object: File (name of the image attached) not found*

h3. Workaround

You can download the image, rename it and then you will be able to attach it to a new comment box.
fields.summary: Copy/Paste screenshot from a comment to another on same issue fails to show after refresh on the browser

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce: 
 # User A opens a ticket and starts editing the description, saves the changes.
 # User B also enters the ticket description and start editing it. He/she leaves the description field but without saving the changes. 
 # User A goes in the ticket again and starts editing his/her description. Then saves the changes

Observed result: the changes of User B are overwritten. 

Of course, you find the changes in the history. But transferring this into the description is very time consuming and annoying. It would be really great to have a better process to prevent this overwriting process (e.g. not being able to leave the field without saving/not saving or informing the users that a different user also edits the description at the moment).
fields.summary: As a team we want to be aware if we overwrite changes by a different user when editing a ticket

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Keyboard shortcuts for board's actions don't work for next-gen boards.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to a next-gen board
 # Use any of the keyboard shortcuts for board's action, such as hide/show detail view (t), hide/show menus (z)

h3. Expected Results
* The keyboard shortcut should work in next-gen boards.

h3. Actual Results
* The keyboard shortcuts don't work for next-gen boards.


h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Keyboard shortcuts for board's actions don't work for next-gen boards

fields.description:
From the board view, there will be a drop-down to show how many issues from a column. When it comes to accessing Epic tickets from the board, the user would need to click on the "Epic Link" field and then search for a way to access the Epics from the board.

h4. Current behavior
The total number of issues appears as a drop-down 

h4. Suggestion
It would be beneficial if this can be re-vamps as a hyperlink so that customer can access the Epics real quick.
fields.summary: From the board view, the Number of Issues listed should be a hyperlink instead of a drop-down option

fields.description: Suggestion - Implement DARK MODE in Jira & bitbucket for browser UI.
fields.summary: Suggestion - Implement DARK MODE in Jira & bitbucket UI

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Ability to move an issue from one column to another and set the order at the same time
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Move an issue to another column
 # You can not set the order of the issues

Video: [https://share.getcloudapp.com/12u1rmR4]

h3. Expected Results
 # Move an issue to another column
 # Select the specific order of the issues at the same time

h3. Actual Results
 # Move an issue to another column
 # It's not possible to select the specific order of the issues at the same time

h3. Workaround

Transition the issue, find the issue in the list, move it up or down.
fields.summary: Ability to move an issue from one column to another and set the order at the same time

fields.description:
Allow the possibility of visualizing all the linked issues with an issue in the backlog of Scrum or Kanban boards in the same way that it is possible to see sub-tasks under an issue in the backlog of a Kanban board.

Example:
 !Screen Shot 2020-03-03 at 11.59.23.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Implement drop-down in the backlog view to see linked issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If a rule is created to set the field *Story points Estimate* to a value on a transition, in a *Next Gen Scrum* board, it fails with the following error.
 !Screenshot 2020-03-03 at 7.44.54 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Next Gen project using the scrum template.
 # Once created, go to it's board and try to create a rule of type *Update an issue field* as follows.
 !Screenshot 2020-03-03 at 7.47.36 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# Click *Add*.

h3. Expected Results
* The rule should be successfully created.

h3. Actual Results
* An error is thrown.

* Console log suggests the below response for the call /rest/internal/simplified/1.0/projects/<pid>/issuetypes/<issuetype>/transitions/xx/rules/all
{noformat}
{"errorMessages":[],"errors":{"customfield_xxxxxx":"Selected field is not valid."}}
{noformat}
* Removing the *Story point estimate* field from the issuetype in the call OR even deleting the issuetype from the project doesn't help.
* From support side, tried unlocking the custom field before adding the rule. This didn't help either.

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Creating a rule on Story Point Estimate field throws error

fields.description:
*Summary:*

We would like the development panel to have bi-directional linking between Bitbucket Cloud and Jira issues. This is in the interest to make best use of the Development dashboard.

*Steps to reproduce:*

1. Create a Jira issue of type Story (say AB-123 be the Jira issue key)
 2. Create a branch and some commits without mentioning the Jira issue key AB-123 (i.e. no link established yet between AB-123 and bitbucket/git just yet - observe that the Jira issue still shows "Create branch" as the only available content in its Development panel (Initial state))
 3. Create a PR for that branch and mention AB-123 in the PR "Description" field with the intention to link it by doing so
 4. Optional: Approve/Merge the PR

*Observation:*

A) In the created PR Description field the string "AB-123" is displayed as hyperlink and upon click navigates to the Jira issue with issuekey AB-123 - that is expected behaviour and is OK from my point of view; and it gives the impression that the Jira issue has been linked successfully.
 B) When navigating to Jira issue AB-123, the Development panel does not show any information about the PR, the branch, the commits, the deployment status etc.; instead it shows the initial state link "Create branch" as the only available content - This is not the expected behaviour from my point of view.

*Request:*

At least there is an inconsistency in linking the Jira issue, as in point A) above it seems like the Jira issue was successfully linked but in point B) above it becomes apparent that this link is only one way. The expected intuitive behaviour (from my point of view) would be for the linking to be consistent, i.e. both ways.
fields.summary: Consistent Linking of Jira software with Bitbucket Cloud

fields.description:
Hello Jira Folks,

I would like to be able to filter the cumulative flow report by project type. We use this field to categorise tasks based on business group, to understand velocity of work from specific areas of the business. Or we did, on Jira server. 

Would be splendid to retain that functionality on next gen.
fields.summary: Cumulative Flow Report - Filter by Project Type

fields.description:
The ability to link issues in a parent child relationships would be a very powerful feature.

In my opinion, this feature would be targeted more to project managers and product owners and anyone who would be involved in the creation of product backlog, managing the prioritization the delivery of that backlog and reporting against enterprise projects.

Parent child links would allow project managers and product owners to elaborate a product backlog and represent it as a hierarchy of successively smaller and more detailed backlog items.  For instance a backlog could start from a “root“ issue of Type: Project which could be broken down as one or more Features, each with there own Epics which would be further broken down into Stories and their Subtasks.

Creating a backlog as a hierarchy of linked issues would be useful for managing execution and reporting against project delivery.  Automated workflows could be written that would traverse an entire backlog or just a single branch of that backlog to apply logic such as updating parent issues when child issues change.  A hierarchy of linked issues could also form the basis of customized reports that could communicate, among other things, overall project status or feature completion status.
fields.summary: Parent Child Issue Link Type

fields.description:
h2. Problem

Currently, it's not possible to link a page to a Sprint on next-gen the same as we can on a Classic project.
h2. Suggestion

Add the same option as a Classic project.

- [Link a Confluence page to a sprint|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/link-a-confluence-page-to-a-sprint/?]
fields.summary: Ability to link pages to a Sprint when using next-gen

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customers who have a large NextGen Kanban board would like to review the images/attachments that are used for their [Issue Cover Images|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Next-gen-articles/You-asked-for-it-so-we-delivered-images-on-issues-have-arrived/ba-p/844691] and may want to Bulk Remove the Cover Images for Issues that have been completed and/or are not currently prioritized

h3. Suggested Solution
Include an API Endpoint that would allow a Board Admin to query All Issues for their Cover Images and add options to Modify (if there are other compatible files) or Remove the Cover Image while keeping the Attachments on the Issue

h3. Why this is important
The GET Issue API Endpoint will show all attachments on an Issue, but does not indicate which one is being used as the Cover Image

Customers may not want to Hide All Cover Images across the Board
 
h3. Workaround 
Users can manually Hide Cover Images from individual Issues or a All Cover Images can be toggled to be shown or hidden
fields.summary: API Endpoint to View, Change, or Remove Cover Images

fields.description:
As a user, the option to automatically expand all issues on the backlog view so as to avoid repeatedly seeking the 'Show all issues' option each time this page is loaded. 

Instead of switch to backlog, CTRL-F to find a ticket number now it's switch to backlog, scroll down a bit, click link, CTRL-F.
fields.summary: Display all issues in the backlog view automatically
Rule "Assign an issue to someone" not work in the first board status

fields.description:
h3. *Problem*

Comment restriction was added to the new issue view, but it didn't include team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects, so currently, the comments are visible to anyone that has access to the project.
h3. *Suggestion*

Add the comment restriction feature to team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects.
fields.summary: Comment restriction for team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary

"Fix Versions" field can be set by users that do not have "Resolve Issues" permission when the issue is created from Backlog after selecting the Version on the sidebar.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Make sure that you DO NOT have "Resolve Issues" permission
# Create a Version
# Go to Backlog and show Versions panel
# Select one of the Versions
# Create an issue from the Backlog

h3. Expected Results

The new issue will not have a value in "Fix Versions" field.

h3. Actual Results

The new issue automatically has the version selected in "Fix Versions" field.

h3. Workaround

There is no workaround.
fields.summary: Fix Versions can be set without "Resolve Issues" permission

fields.description:
As of now, there wasn't an official SDK version that is released by Atlassian for Jira Cloud. The only support SDK by Atlassian is from:

* https://developer.atlassian.com/server/framework/atlassian-sdk/?_ga=2.38713187.197865431.1582788467-845740345.1582788467

And the current one is maintained by its Repository owner from [here|https://bitbucket.org/farmas/atlassian.net-sdk/issues/509/jirauser-api-v2-updated-for-gdpr-removing]

But this is still on Alpha release, and it would be nice to have if Atlassian come with their own 
SDK version.
fields.summary: New version of SDK which is supported by Atlassian
Inconsistent notification template for notifications triggered by REST end point

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
At this moment, Jira admins are not stopped from creating a classic software board from a Next-gen project. As such, if the filter of this board contains several Next-gen projects, on the column mapping of this board, the Next-gen statuses will appear duplicated. This happens because Jira treats each Next-gen project as an individual entity.

The problem with this design is admins cannot differentiate which status belong to which Next-gen project.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create multiple Next-gen projects;
 # Create a filter with those Next-gen projects;
 # Create a classic software board from this filter;
 # Access the column mapping of this board:

h3. Expected Results
Statuses with the same name are shown only once.

h3. Actual Results

Several statuses with the same name are shown, without differentiation on which Next-gen project they belong to.

 !image-2020-02-13-10-59-00-779.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Admins can either remove the Next-gen projects from the filter used by the board or consider migrating their Next-gen project to classic ones.
fields.summary: Classic software boards which contains multiple Next-gen projects show multiple duplicated statuses in the column mapping

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using shortcut G+A which would direct you to your most recently visited JIRA Agile board, returns a blank left sidebar.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to board
 # use the G+A shortcut and it will redirect you to a blank left sidebar

h3. Expected Results

Must direct you to the most recently visited Jira Agile board.

h3. Actual Results

Takes you to the recent board with a blank left side bar

h3. Workaround

Fully refresh the webpage and this will show all options expected on the left sidebar.
fields.summary: G+A shortcut returns blank left side bar

fields.description:
In the backlog, a task with sub-tasks has no difference from a single task. Having a visual difference would be helpful to see that this task is more complex than it appears.

When a task contains sub-tasks, its icon could be updated with a "second square" like on the "Create sub-task" icon.

!image-2020-02-24-09-45-59-654.png!
fields.summary: Update icon for tasks with sub-tasks

fields.description:
I like the fading in and out and bar curving on Next Gen project roadmaps for "no start date" "no end date" epics.  (I'd love if it was even more pronounced!) 

I *don't* like that they imply that they're starting "around now" by all sitting on the today line. For epics that don't have any start or end forecast, that usually means they're "_somewhere out there_" and aren't well planned.  It would be great if their hazy start was one of:
 # Out past the end of the latest recorded end date
 # Some configured number of days from now
 # Some fixed number of days from now that is more like 60 and not 0
 # Just not represented by bars at all until they get start dates

Right now my roadmap looks sensible for next 4-8 epics, and then there's a series of month-long bars for a bunch of "someday/maybe" epics.  I'd like to more strongly show to any user that the start date of these isn't anytime soon.
fields.summary: Move next-gen roadmap "no start date / no due date" epics out into the future

fields.description:
As a Scrum Board user I'd like to see the all type issues linked to story in story swimlane.

for example.

'STELA-681' contains  STELA-751, STELA-511.

and this issues are look like below picture.

!image-2020-02-24-12-41-16-060.png!
fields.summary: Using 'link' relations in swimlanes of agile board.

fields.description: As a team lead I need to have an overview over billable hours as well as registered hours
fields.summary: Next gen projects + Tempo  : where did billable hours go ?

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when user tried to make any changes to Active Sprint (adding issue or changing estimate), JIRA will show "Sprint scope will be affected by this action" message.

Some users would like option to turn off this message.


h3. Suggested Solution

Add toggle option in Board general configuration to allow Board Administrator to turn off this message.


h3. Workaround 

None
fields.summary: Turn off "Sprint scope will be affected by this action" message

fields.description: Our team uses quick filters heavily on our claissic boards, can we get this on next-gen so we can move to it for the awesome road map feature?
fields.summary: Allow quick filters in next gen

fields.description:
As a user I would like to be able to modify the card view in the active sprint and backlogs.  Our team adds components, status, and fix version the boards to help us plan releases.  

Another option would be to allow for modifying the columns shown on the releases page.
fields.summary: Modify Board lay out in next-gen boards

fields.description:
Currently, the quick search box on boards only works for issue keys and issue summary.
It would be nice if this search was based on the card layout the customer uses on the board. This would allow customers to search for custom fields as well.
fields.summary: Quick search box on boards should be based on card layouts

fields.description:
As user, I would like to be able to see issues associated to a version in versions page. A drill down like issues associated to epics in roadmap would be perfect.

!image-2020-02-21-12-58-39-875.png!

The possibility of drag and drop issues between versions would be nice too.
fields.summary: As user, I would like to be able to see issues associated to a version in versions page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When an issue that is moved to the rightmost column in a next-gen project, the issue will have a resolution value, but the issue doesn't get strikethrough

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Move an issue to the rightmost column in a next-gen project


h3. Expected Results
* The issue should get strikethrough

h3. Actual Results
* The issue doesn't get strikethrough
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Issues with Resolution value doesn't get strikethrough in next-gen

fields.description:
It would be great if we have separate JQL to list out issue that are in backlog or on board.

This will also help in creating dashboard.
fields.summary: JQL to list out the issue that are in board or in backlog for team-managed (formerly next-gen) project

fields.description:
h3. Update:

We are happy to announce that the feature has been implemented and is now available.

Please refer to documentation:
 * Classic [https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/add-issues-to-epics-on-the-roadmap/#Reorder-or-reassign-an-issue-to-an-epic]
 * Next-gen [https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/manage-epics-on-the-roadmap/#Reorder-or-reassign-an-issue-to-an-epic]

h3. ---
h3. Problem Definition

After implementing JSWCLOUD-17442 the option to drill down to stories was added to the roadmap but the ability to re-order the child issues is not possible from the roadmap.
h3. Suggested Solution

Add the ability to rank from the Roadmap view
h3. Workaround

Child issues of the epic are ordered by Rank, and Ranking is currently done in the backlog view, switch to the backlog and rank issues as desired, the position will be reflected in the Roadmap
fields.summary: Ability to Rank Children issues in Roadmap view

fields.description:
Currently all of the reports use the point estimate in order to track the amount of work that was done but there are times when estimate and the work done point value don't match.

For the purpose of retrospectives it would be great to see a report for each sprint that displayed the point estimate vs the points spends so that our team can review what we may have missed, underestimated or overestimated and help us improve estimations going forward.
fields.summary: Next Gen Estimate vs Spent Report

fields.description:
You can create a custom field for classic projects and another for Next-gen projects with the same name.

In advanced search when you start typing to fill the field name both appear but there is nothing to identify if one is for classic and the other for next-gen and this can cause confusion.

A suggestion is to don't allow to use the same name if it already exists.
fields.summary: Restrict Next-gen custom fields name if already exists another custom field with the same name

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When updating a board, it shows a popup informing "This board has been updated: Refresh". This message appears when we are updating a board and not when another user who is using the same board update a ticket.
h3. Suggestion

Consider the pop up as "Notifications of your changes", so it can be disabled in our profile.
fields.summary: Disable "This board has been updated: Refresh" when updating a ticket

fields.description: Allow the status of a release to be displayed on the card of a board. Much easier to get an idea of where you are at without having to open every individual item.
fields.summary: View Releases Panel as Card Item

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Recently [Releases and Versions have been added to Next-Gen | https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Next-gen-articles/New-features-for-next-gen-projects-in-Jira-Software-Cloud/ba-p/1232149] projects, and it would be useful to display the Start and End date milestones on the roadmap view for better visibility into the release versions timeline compared to the issues on the roadmap.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a vertical line with release name and date indicating the start and end dates of releases in the roadmap view
fields.summary: Show Release dates in Roadmap

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When moving a ticket from Classic to Next-gen, if that ticket had an epic, it’s still visible in next-gen in the breadcrumb, but impossible to remove, even when added to a next-gen epic. It looks like there’s 2 levels of epics now.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Move some issues that is tied to a Classic Epic into a next-gen project and associate that issue to a next-gen Epic

h3. Expected Results

An issue should only have 1 Epic
h3. Actual Results

Two Epics are linked to the same ticket, which shouldn't happen
 !multiple-epics.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When an issue in a classic project with epic gets moved to a next-gen project, it'll have double epics and can't be removed

fields.description:
h3. Problem:

Currently, the permissions on next-gen projects are very limited and we can't make the project public.
h3. Suggestion:

Add "Browse projects" permission to next-gen projects.
fields.summary: Allow Anonymous access to next-gen projects

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Sometimes stakeholders don't need full access to Jira projects/roadmaps, they only need read-only access to follow the progress of the companies projects. They end up consuming a license in Jira to have this ability.
h3. Why is it important?
Jira admins would like to share project progresses among stakeholders/customers without having to pay for another user license, since they will not have to interact with the tickets/projects.
h3. Suggested resolution
Allow users with read-only accounts that have their access limited for cuple functions determinated by the instance administrator.
fields.summary: Ability to create read-only access to Jira projects/roadmaps

fields.description:
When using the /rest/api/3/label to return the labels in use in Jira issues, it include labels that were used once and removed, causing them to no longer be valid labels (there is a notation to add new label if you try to use it).

As an expected result, the /rest/api/3/label endpoint should only return labels that are active, removing those that don't have any association with the issues.
fields.summary: The /rest/api/3/label endpoint return Labels that are no longer in use

fields.description:
As a Jira user, I want to see additional columns especially the Team value.

As a Jira project admin, I want to customize the Release page according to the users' needs.

For example, in my project, [https://thermofisher-asg.atlassian.net/projects/AA/versions/11438/tab/release-report-todo] has only the following columns: P T Key Summary Assignee Status
The assignee is not really important in the Agile world, but the R&D team is more central in our point of view.

Note: the Release page may be already customized, but I have not found how to do it. Please help.
fields.summary: Customize the Release page by adding some column like Team

fields.description:
On team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects, the Release option was released recently which shows "Fix versions" in tickets, but we are unable to add "Affects versions".

Please, add Affects version as part of the Release feature in team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects.
fields.summary: Affects Version/s in team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When a Kanban board is configured to display swimlanes based on Stories, the current status for each Story is displayed next to the swimlane title. If the board is configured to display swimlanes based on Epic, no status indicator is shown.
h3. Suggested Solution

Display the current status of the Epic in the swimlane title as is done with Story based swimlanes.
h3. Workaround

No workaround at this time.
fields.summary: Display Epic Status in Kanban Swimlane

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Scrolling on a Next-gen board with a considerable number of cards is slow when using a larger screen. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use a large computer screen
 # Create a next-gen project
 # Add a considerable number of cards to it like 300+
 # Make sure that there are enough columns in the board to your browser enable the sideways scrolling
 # Try to scroll up, down, and sideways

h3. Expected Results
Scrolling should be fast as the small screen behaves:
 [^ScrollNext-Gen small screen.mp4] 

h3. Actual Results
Scrolling is slow using the large screen:
 [^ScrollNext-Gen.mp4] 

h3. Workaround
Zoom out your browser, use a smaller screen or ensure that there are not many cards in the board.
fields.summary: Scrolling on a Next-gen board with a considerable number of cards is slow when using a larger screen

fields.description: Per Leidos" {color:#000000}The ask here is to request a feature request where the device or the work profile does not get wiped on the device when the max failed attempts are met.  Instead a delay or extended time where the users is given until the next time, they are able to enter their password again. {color}
fields.summary: Feature request where the device or the work profile does not get wiped on the device when the max failed attempts are met.  Instead a delay or extended time where the users is given until the next time, they are able to enter their password again.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When choosing a GIPHY from the new media pop-up and adding as attachment in the issue, the 'Show on card' button won't appear and customers are not able to use these gifs as cards on their issues.
 !Screen Shot 2020-02-12 at 11.55.15.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a ticket and add a GIPHY as attachment;
# Wait the file to load;
# Try to select the 'Show on card' button, but you won't have it
 !Screen Shot 2020-02-12 at 11.57.23.png|thumbnail! 

- The problem is intermittent 

h3. Workaround
Save the file as a local file, then rename it with the .gif extension and upload the file again, without using GIPHY
fields.summary: GIPHY is not working properly as next-gen cards

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Exporting Jira roadmap doesn't work on Safari and Chrome browsers if the roadmap has complex dependencies lines drawn on issues.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup a Jira roadmap project with complex dependencies, for example link an issue to multiple issues.
 # Click on "Export".
 # Export modal pops up and generate image from roadmap.

h3. Expected Results

Image successfully generated.
h3. Actual Results

See spinner spinning with no image generated.
h3. Workaround

Export in another browser e.g Firefox.
fields.summary: Next-gen roadmap export image on Safari and Chrome fails to generate image

fields.description:
When Quick Filters spans two lines, the Issue Detail menu (available via the ellipse icon in the right panel) that includes functions like Move and Delete appears to be hidden.  

Collapsing the Quick Filter listing enables viewing the menu when clicking the ellipse.

It would be nice if the menu could appear regardless of the number of quick filters displayed.
fields.summary: Prevent hidden Issue Details menu

fields.description:
When you open dialog in Jira Classic / next-gen Project's Kanban Board using the new detail dialog view, the web page title is stays as the name of board. This is pretty problematic when you bookmark and export list of issues to others since all items look same.

Please reflect the Issue title that has been open on the screen.
fields.summary: Web Page Title for Issue Details View in Dialog

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The chart of the Version report isn't re-adjusted when issues are removed from a version. Even though you complete all the issues currently available in the release, the chart won't show the completion as 100%

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a classic Scrum project and add issues to it
# Add story points estimation to the issues
# Create a release and add the estimated issues to the release
# Create a sprint and add the same issues to it
# Start the sprint
# Complete 2 issues and remove others from the version
# See the Version report

h3. Expected Results

The Report should re-adjust itself and consider the current total estimation and issues

h3. Actual Results

The report still considers the estimation of the removed issues and even though you complete all the issues related to this release, the chart won't show 100% of completion

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The chart of the Version report isn't re-adjusted when issues are removed from a version

fields.description: We have defined a custom dropdown field on our issues and we would like to be able to filter on this while doing backlog grooming and sprint planning using the Backlog view.
fields.summary: Ability to filter by custom field in Backlog view

fields.description: It would be extremely useful to be able to filter by fixVersion in the Backlog view.
fields.summary: Ability to filter by fixVersion in Backlog view

fields.description:
Hi,

As a Jira user, I would like to assign multiple people to certain tasks based on business requirements. 


Jira: Jira Next Gen.

Currently, this is a HIGH requirement for my company.
fields.summary: Assign multiple users to JIRA Tasks

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The customers want to have an option to disable the "On-call" feature in all of their software projects globally.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a project either Company-managed or Team-managed.
 # The "On-call" feature with links to Ops-Genie is enabled by default.
 # We can disable this feature from "Project settings > Features".
 # For the customers who do not use Ops-Genie, this feature is causing confusion among their users. They have to disable the "On-call" feature each time when they created a new project. Hence, they are asking for a feature to disable/enable it globally. This should disable any Ops-genie-related plugins also.

h3. Expected Results

There should be an option to disable the "On-call" feature globally so that it will not enable by default during new project creation.
h3. Actual Results

Currently, whenever new software projects are created "On-call" feature will enable by default and requiring extra steps to disable it by going into "Project settings > features".
h3. Workaround

This "On-call" feature can disable from "Project settings > Features".
fields.summary: Ability to disable "On-call" feature globally

fields.description:
Summary:
* When a board consist of multiple projects with RANK enabled. Some of the columns will have multiple issues status in it. Due to this, the issue ordered randomly.

Suggestion:
* To order the issue by status automatically while the RANK is enabled.
fields.summary: Ability to order by Status while RANK is enabled.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Text Filter on next-gen board does not work when grouping by Epic or Subtask

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # on your next-gen board group by Epic or Subtask
 # use the 'Filter issue' search box and type in a Task name 

h3. Expected Results
Search to find the related text on your board

h3. Actual Results
Search returns nothing

h3. Workaround
Change the "Group by" to "none" and use the filter to search for related text
fields.summary: Text Filter on next-gen board does not work when grouping by Epic or Subtask

fields.description:
Please add an option to my user profile to prevent notifications from being sent when an issue I'm watching/voted on/created/assigned to receives a new comment where the only contents are "+1".

I don't need this for my own instance of Jira Cloud, by the way.  I need it right here on Atlassian's own instance where Jira's own issues are tracked!

For example, I'm watching this issue and the +1 notifications are just silly:

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-17214

And no amount of other commenters trying to inform +1 posters that +1 doesn't help anyone (vote, people!) is helping to prevent additional +1 comments from being added.  I'm sure this is system-wide and that perhaps 10's of thousands of individual watchers would be ever so grateful for this feature!

Yes, my e-mail client may be able to filter these kinds of messages out if I get tricky, but really, this should totally be a built-in option in Jira!

Everyone reading this, for (insert your favorite deity here)'s sake, *do not post a +1 comment on this issue - vote for it instead!*  If you want to add your two cents in a comment, awesome, but just don't add a (that deity again) forsaken +1, OK?! :)
fields.summary: Prevent notifications with +1 comments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When Next-gen board is configured to show greater than 300 cards, the *initial load of the board* will be slower and card transition is also affected.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have next-gen project type and create 300+ issues
 # Open Next-gen board

h3. Expected Results

Next-gen board would *initially load* in a similar time to boards with 300 cards
h3. Actual Results

The board loads very slow and it affects the navigation within that board.
h3. Workaround
 # *Reduce number of cards on the board by using a backlog (focusing the board on immediate work)*, which currently has great features such as the epic panel and versions panel that allows you to bulk-update issues: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Next-gen-articles/Improved-Backlog-planning-in-next-gen-with-the-epic-panel/ba-p/1387675]
 # *Moving cards to “Done” (resolved) column to be cleared from the board if you did not enable sprints:* [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Next-gen-articles/Introducing-manual-board-clearing-for-your-next-gen-Kanban-board/ba-p/1411958]
 # *Not visualising Releases on the board* (aka. having a column with RELEASES), as if you are not doing continuous releases (e.g. monthly releases), you'd wait a long time to clear the board. Track Releases in the Releases view: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Next-gen-articles/New-features-for-next-gen-projects-in-Jira-Software-Cloud/ba-p/1232149]
 # *Switch to Classic projects and migrate issues over*

 
|Hi everyone,
  
 Thanks for your contributions to this issue, they’ve been a great help in diagnosing matters. We’ve been assessing this problem and agree it needs to be resolved. Unfortunately this is a complex task which is going to take some time.
  
 I assure you we’re aiming to have it fixed and would like to thank you for your patience.
  
 While I can’t give an exact date that a fix will be ready, I can share that *it will be a question of months rather than weeks or days*. I recognize that this may be disappointing, but I feel it’s important to be *transparent with you* about the level of effort involved so you can plan accordingly.
  
 Regards,
 Ivan Teong
 Product Manager, Jira Software Cloud|
fields.summary: Performance degradation of Next-gen boards with more than 300 cards during initial load

fields.description:
When viewing a board, we can use the keyboard button z to hide menus, and F11 to hide most browser elements. However, this is hard for many SMs to remember. It would be nice to have a keyboard shortcut that did both in the same combo. E.g. Z to do both (hide menus and make browser go fullscreen).

Then we would only need to learn our SMs a single keyboard shortcut :-).
fields.summary: Make browser go fullscreen on board z buttom

fields.description:
h3. Summary
On the New Issue View, Jira doesn't allow users to create a subtask under an epic but on the Old Issue View, you can create it:

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Epic
# Access this Epic *in the Old Issue View*
# Click on More button(*. . .*) on the top right
# Click on Sub task

h3. Expected Results
* Jira should not allow to create sub task under an Epic

h3. Actual Results
* Jira allow a user to create a sub task on the old issue view
fields.summary: On the Old Issue View, a Subtask can be created under an Epic

fields.description:
*Description*

When using the Group By filter the board only displays parent cards such as "Stories".

*Improvement*

The board should display all cards owned by the assignee regardless of type.

The current implementation has us switching between the  Group By Task and Group By None and it makes the stand up cumbersome and confusing.
fields.summary: NexGen - Display all cards assigned to Assignee

fields.description:
i didn't find any feature in Board setting where i can define few Policies for each column.

like only person having specific right can change the status from one column to another column. etc...
fields.summary: Policies should be defined for each Column in Kanban Board.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When navigating in Agile boards (Scrum, Kanban) and clicking on an issue card, it will open the issue detail view in a pop-up. Clicking in an attachment inside that issue, will open the attachment overlay as well.

Currently, if you have either the issue detail view open, or the attachment overlay open, clicking on the browser back button will return your address to previous pages, but the pop-up will stay in the screen.

See the recording:  [^Browser back button problem.mp4] 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Open an Agile board view;
* Click on an issue to open its detail view;
* Click on the browser back button.

h3. Expected Results

The page will navigate back to the previous section, and the detail view will close.

h3. Actual Results

The issue detail view does not close.

h3. Workaround

Use the *Escape (ESC*) button to close the detail view, and the attachment view.

See the recording, in this case I've closed the windows using ESC:  [^Close windows using ESC.mp4]
fields.summary: Browser back button does not work properly in Agile boards

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
NextGen Boards are slow to load if there are a large number of Issues with Images used for covers

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a NextGen Software Project
# Add a large number of issues with Images used as Covers

h3. Expected Results
Board and Images render without significant delay

h3. Actual Results

The board can take 4-6 seconds to load, however, the remaining Cover Elements can take an additional 20-60 seconds to render

h3. Workaround

Hide Cover Images by clicking on the ellipsis icon " ... " and select *Hide cover images*
fields.summary: NextGen Boards are Slow To Load with a Large Number of Cover Images

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to perform direct migration of the project from cloud to cloud due to CSV import bugs with Next-Gen projects.

Listed below are bugs related to this issue.
 * JSWCLOUD-18048: Dropdown custom field type on next-gen project doesn't allow a value via CSV import

 * JRACLOUD-73628: Next-gen CSV Import - cannot import data into "Paragraph" field

 * JRACLOUD-72655: CSV imports does not map Issue types for Next-gen

 * JSWCLOUD-17758: Ability to import issues with parent-child(epic-task) relationship to next-gen project

 * JSWCLOUD-18517: Allow exporting the 'Parent-ID' field to CSV in Next-gen

 * JRACLOUD-72947: Exporting sub-tasks (all fields) from next-gen project returns an error

 * JRACLOUD-72091: As a Jira admin, during the CSV External System Import to a Next-Gen project, the mapping of the "Issue Type" value and the "Story Point Estimate" value is not respected

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Import a CSV file to next-gen project
h3. Expected Results

CSV import into next-gen projects is currently broken
h3. Actual Results

Able to do a CSV import into next-gen projects without loss of data
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to perform direct migration of the project from cloud to cloud due to CSV import bugs with Next-Gen projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The filtering function in the Roadmap in NextGen Project could be improved.
 Jira shows the status Category in the filter options and when you apply the filter it is including any Epic with tasks in that status. However, it is desired to filter by Epic Status, not caring about the tasks.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # in Next Gen Project, have one Sprint with tasks in the 3 status category (To do, progress, Done)
 # Apply a filter in the Roadmap
 #Jira could always show the Epics because it is having tasks in all status, no matter the Epic Status.

h3. Expected Results

Jira should only show the Epics with the statusCategory you filtered based on the Epic Status not in the children's status.

Let's say the Epic has 2 To DO tasks, 1 Progress Task and 3 Done Task but the Epic is DONE. Jira should hide the Epic if we selected Any Status different than DONE. 
h3. Actual Results

Jira always shows this Epic because it is having tasks in all status, ignoring the Epic Status
   !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: filter Next-Gen Roadmap by epic status

fields.description: Feature to view the total number of story points per user in a sprint in next-gen projects is currently unavailable.
fields.summary: Feature to view the total number of story points per user in a sprint in next-gen projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Date and time format settings are not respected in next-gen backlog

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to https://<instance>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/AdvancedApplicationProperties.jspa and change the followings:
** jira.date.time.picker.java.format
** jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format
# Navigate to a classic scrum project and see its backlog. Under each of the sprint names, the configured date and time setting is applied as intended
# Navigate to a next-gen scrum project and see its backlog

h3. Expected Results
The configured date and time setting is applied 

h3. Actual Results
The setting is not applied
 
h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Date and time format settings are not respected in next-gen backlog

fields.description:
h3. Description
From the Jira interface, the ability to delete a Next-Gen board is forbidden. There is no option for that, however, it is possible to delete a next-gen board using the following REST API
{code}
DELETE /rest/agile/1.0/board/<board ID>
{code}

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Get the project board ID
# Run the following DELETE operation using the following API
{code}
/rest/agile/1.0/board/<Board ID>
{code}

h3. Expected Results
The operation should not be applicable for Next-Gen boards

h3. Actual Results
The Board is deleted and the project no longer has a board, causing the project menu settings to not be loaded, only the issues are displayed.
This causes mal-functioning for Next-Gen projects.

h3. Workaround
Create a new Next-Gen project and [migrate the issues to the new project|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/migrate-between-next-gen-and-classic-projects-957974933.html]
fields.summary: Users can delete Next-Gen boards using REST API
Fields hidden in the field configuration scheme appear as option in the "Issue Detail View"

fields.description: you might want to remove those logs from the console for the users . It is Jira rapidboard. !image-2020-01-28-10-49-28-242.png|width=272,height=364!
fields.summary: Remove the logs from the console for production

fields.description:
That's something that consistently requires several unnecessary clicks: when selecting an epic from "Add epic" in an issue details view, there's a handy dropdown that shows "recent epics". However if you happen to need an epic that is not within these recent epics, you need to click on "view all epics" and select the required one.

I'd vote for this "recent epics" dropdown to be based on most recently used epics, or just show the whole list.
fields.summary: Add epic dropdown shows random recent epics

fields.description:
The Jira/GitHub integration is super helpful for traceability between tickets and commits. Currently, by referencing a Jira ticket in a commit and pushing that commit to GitHub, a reference to that commit will automatically show up on that ticket in Jira.

The integration doesn't, however, appear to garbage collect references to dangling commits. These references can crop up very often during the course of normal software development, for example when rebasing, squashing, or cherry picking in git and pushing to GitHub, the "orphaned" commits will still have references in Jira on the associated ticket. In git, dangling commits can be removed using `git prune` for garbage collection.

Unfortunately, lack of garbage collection in Jira results in, depending on software workflow, sometimes many (> 10) references to dangling commits on a particular ticket, which reduces the utility of the Jira and GitHub integration. Some mechanism for garbage collection of references on tickets to dangling commits would greatly improve usability. Ideally this would happen automatically behind the scenes, for example via a garbage collection mechanism similar to `git prune` for ticket <-> commit references within Jira. However, even adding the ability to remove commit references manually on tickets would be helpful, e.g. a garbage can icon next to each commit reference.
fields.summary: Remove links to dangling GitHub commits on Jira tickets

fields.description:
h4. Summary
Currently, there isn't a REST API endpoint to get the percentage of completed child issues of an Epic. 

It would be helpful to get that percentage through a REST API endpoint.

 !Screen Shot 2020-01-23 at 17.08.56.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Create a REST API endpoint to retrieve the percentage of completed issues inside Epics

fields.description:
In addition to project avatars, it'd be nice to have the ability to add an avatar to sprints (which would appear next to the sprint name) to coordinate with potential naming and visually differentiate between sprints in the Backlog.

 

!Screen Shot 2020-01-23 at 1.18.23 PM.png|width=674,height=430!
fields.summary: Add Ability to Upload an Avatar to Sprint Details

fields.description:
Please implement folders for favorite links in the sidebar of NextGen Kanban. At present, you can only create one link at a time manually which pile up in the sidebar.

If we could create a folder called "Login Portals" and create favorite links under there that remain hidden, this would save so much clutter. This would also allow the Kanban to truly be a one stop shop for navigation and workflow.
fields.summary: Create link folders in sidebar for Next Gen Kanban

fields.description:
I work at a company with a large service team and a small dev team, I would love to be able to communicate the road map to the rest of the organization without them needing Jira Accounts (we currently can't afford that extra burn).

*As a* Product Owner *In Order To* keep the organization abreast of what we are developing *I want*  a public/semipublic version of the roadmap that I can share out on slack, or put on wallboards around the office.

AC:

- A non-guessable link to a read-only version of the roadmap that would allow minimal browsing of issues. Just subject lines for epics/stories/subtasks.
fields.summary: Allow the roadmap widget to be fully public

fields.description:
The priority icons are not accessible to users with visual impairments.

If you have limited color vision you are unable to tell the difference between a dark red up arrow, a medium red up arrow, and an orange up arrow.

We used to be able to fix this in server based Jira to bring us into line with disability discrimination law, but there's no option to customise this in the cloud / next-gen projects.

*Suggestion:*

Change the highest / lowest status icons to have a trailing dot to visually distinguish them from high / low

Change the medium status icon to have arrow heads at both ends to indicate that it's in the middle.
fields.summary: Make the priority icons accessible to users with limited color vision

fields.description:
Hi,

Will it be possible to use "Jira Cloud for Mac" with a Self-hosted Jira server ?

Kind regards 

Romain
fields.summary: Jira Cloud for Mac and Self hosted server

fields.description:
Currently, the Velocity report supports only story points.

As a next-gen user, I want to have "issue count" as an option in the Velocity report
fields.summary: As a next-gen user, I want to have "issue count" as an option in the Velocity report

fields.description:
{panel:title=(i) Bug Fix Policy| borderStyle=| borderColor=| titleBGColor=#e0efff| bgColor=}
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for the fix to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes bugfixes.
You can learn more by reading [Atlassian Cloud Bug Fixing Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-cloud-bug-fixing-policy-206865884.html].
{panel}

h3. Issue Summary
Non-English user is unable to change access for nex-gen project.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences and switch the language to "Japanese"
# Try changing access of a next-gen project
** !access-ja.png|thumbnail! 
** !error-message-ja.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

Any user can change access in any project if they have permission.

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the browser console:

{code:none}
Invariant Violation: "[React Intl] An `id` must be provided to format a message."
    exports browser.js:38
    fe index.es.js:670
    yt index.js:137
    React 6
    unstable_runWithPriority scheduler.production.min.js:20
    React 5
    r helpers.js:74
captureconsole.js:63:45
{code}


h3. Workaround

You won't face the error with English:

# Go to https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences and switch the language to "English (US)"
**  !modal-en.png|thumbnail!  

Then consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of the bug moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Non-English user is unable to change access for nex-gen project

fields.description:
It would be nice if jira user could filter by "affected version" as same as "fix version".
This feature is useful for the user who tracking problems/bugs by "affected version".

We need to be able to manage issues by "affected version" in backlog since Improvements are a requirement for features that have already been released.
If it is a cloud service, there is only one latest version. However, if it is open source project, all the source code is released for each version. Bugs occur not only for the latest version but also for past released versions. We need to focus "affected version" when manage them.
fields.summary: Ability to filter by affected version in Scrum backlog.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using a different language, trying to update a Next-Gen project access level will fail.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a Next-Gen Project;
# Change your profile Language to Portuguese or Spanish, for example;
# Try to update the project access.

h3. Expected Results

The access will be properly set.

h3. Actual Results

The following error is displayed:
{code}
    at e.exports (https://jira-frontend-prod-us-1.us-east-1.prod.public.atl-paas.net/assets-brotli/vendor~748942c6.7d76c1e78e57f37449f7.8.js:2:433104)
    at me (https://jira-frontend-prod-us-1.us-east-1.prod.public.atl-paas.net/assets-brotli/vendor~690b702c.a62d36f23fd79fd14235.8.js:2:475416)
    at ProjectAccessWarning (https://jira-frontend-prod-us-1.us-east-1.prod.public.atl-paas.net/assets-brotli/async-project-access-modal-view-wrapper.8f7fc115c6953699fa1c.8.js:1:37338)
    at ka (https://jira-frontend-prod-us-1.us-east-1.prod.public.atl-paas.net/assets-brotli/vendor~690b702c.a62d36f23fd79fd14235.8.js:2:410814)
    at Wc (https://jira-frontend-prod-us-1.us-east-1.prod.public.atl-paas.net/assets-brotli/vendor~690b702c.a62d36f23fd79fd14235.8.js:2:453510)
    at _c (https://jira-frontend-prod-us-1.us-east-1.prod.public.atl-paas.net/assets-brotli/vendor~690b702c.a62d36f23fd79fd14235.8.js:2:439198)
    at yc (https://jira-frontend-prod-us-1.us-east-1.prod.public.atl-paas.net/assets-brotli/vendor~690b702c.a62d36f23fd79fd14235.8.js:2:436230)
    at Mc (https://jira-frontend-prod-us-1.us-east-1.prod.public.atl-paas.net/assets-brotli/vendor~690b702c.a62d36f23fd79fd14235.8.js:2:434823)
    at https://jira-frontend-prod-us-1.us-east-1.prod.public.atl-paas.net/assets-brotli/vendor~690b702c.a62d36f23fd79fd14235.8.js:2:397291
    at t.unstable_runWithPriority (https://jira-frontend-prod-us-1.us-east-1.prod.public.atl-paas.net/assets-brotli/vendor~31ecd969.00c3f8b83ed18a8be216.8.js:2:280950)
{code}

h3. Workaround

Update your profile language to English, update the project access and go back to your original language.
fields.summary: When using a different language, trying to update a Next-Gen project access level will fail

fields.description:
Recently I responded to a user research that you guys sent us via e-mail. 

 

It was quite nice to take part of it but I forgot to mention one thing (sort of a complaint actually).

 

I find your e-mails VERY confusing. I'm sure it's possible do make a more user friendly layout. I mean the e-mails sent when a member of a board, for example, moves a task inside the board or comment on it or edit it.

That's it. Thanx for your attention.
fields.summary: E-mails feedback

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Board columns doesn't include statuses even if those statuses are part of the workflows. Even if the workflows have those statuses, they show up as invalid in the board columns.

h3. Workaround

Other than modifying the board filter along the lines of the workaround stated in JSWCLOUD-11623. there is no identified workaround.
fields.summary: Board columns doesn't include statuses even if those statuses are part of the workflows

fields.description:
We can have as many as four active branches with PR's for all in the pull request panel in JIRA and to know which is for which branch requires a lot of clicking and possible mistakes. Could branch info be added or shown when hovering or similar?

I believe the same issue is in 
 # JSWSERVER-14955, but as that seems to be the wrong project, I add it here too.
fields.summary: Ability to see what branch a PR is related to

fields.description:
h3.Summary

The current Roadmap Gadget on JIRA do not show released versions only upcoming unreleased versions.  As a user I will want to have the ability to also be able to embed the JIRA Roadmap plans in JIRA dashboards similar to how it works in Confluence pages. 

With this, we will not need to go through every project just to view the roadmap. This will allow us to consolidate all the road maps on the dashboard.
fields.summary: Allow JIRA Roadmap plans to be embedded in JIRA dashboard similar to how it works in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using German language, changing the next-gen project access will result in an error and the project access is not changed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use any other language aside from English for your user: https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences
 # Navigate to a next-gen's project settings
 # Click on *Access* on the left
 # Change the project access

h3. Expected Results
* The project access is changed.

h3. Actual Results
* The page becomes blank and there's an error on the bottom left
**  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
* Use *English* language to change the project access. Change the user preference in your Atlassian Account: https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences
fields.summary: Cannot change next-gen project access when using languages other than English

fields.description: As a devops designer, I would like to use Jira's version release date to propagate to other release management systems the precise date and TIME a release should occur. Saying I would like a release on June 3rd isn't enough - I might not want it to start at midnight of June 3rd, I might want it to start at 8am EST. I will know this is done when I see a time value selector included in the date selector for fix version release dates. I do not need time zone selection - Jira already has that in its main System settings of course!
fields.summary: Add hour, minute to Version release date

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the *Open in Google Sheets* functionality for instances with *jira.com* domains you will get a blank pop up square and it will not redirect you to login into your Google Account and configure it.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1
 Make a search of issues in basic or JQL advance mode
 # Step 2
 With the results displayed click on the Open in Goggle Sheets from the top right next to the Share icon.
h3. Expected Results

Redirects you to configure the Google account where you will be opening the records of your search into a Goggle Spreadsheet.
h3. Actual Results

You get a popup blank square in the middle
 The below exception is thrown in the Console from the Browser:
{noformat}
...Cannot read property 'pop' of null TypeError: Cannot read property 'pop' of null

The Source Code points to atlassian.net only
{noformat}

{code:java}
gs=function(){return new Promise(function(e){return AP.getLocation(function(t){var n=t.match(/https:\/\/\S+\.atlassian\.net/).pop()
{code}
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira Spreadsheets System App not working for jira.com domains

fields.description:
On Next-gen board and backlog, you can create multiple issues at once by paste several lines of text .
It would be nice if we can do the same on roadmap screen.
fields.summary: Ability to create multiple issues at once on Next-gen roadmap

fields.description: The ability to automate the process of creating a Jira project and immediately linking it to a Confluence space means a smaller probability of project documentation ending up in the wrong Confluence space.
fields.summary: Link Confluence space to Jira project through API

fields.description:
As a PM, I would like to change the color of the labels of the issues in the next-gen backlog.

We are working with different customers and some features are profitable to different customers, so we want to easily identify different customers choosing one color per label.

Thank you in advance for considering.
fields.summary: Change the default color of labels

fields.description:
Customers need to restrict the delete or hide a comment functionality in the comments field.

It is possible to restrict the delete permission but not to disable the share comment option, with this, users are able to hide comments.
fields.summary: Ability to disable share comment feature

fields.description:
We need to be able to see the *epic name* related to *every task & subtask*, when running the filter/search below in a NEXT GEN project. 

{color:#000000}project = P1 AND issuetype in (Task, Subtask) AND status in (BLOCKED, "In Progress", "To Do") ORDER BY due ASC{color}

 

Example if I have a project *P1*,  with the following information

*epic1* has a task "*task1*".  "task1" has 2 subtasks "*subtask11*", "*subtask12*"

*epic2* has a task "*task2*".  "task2"  has a subtask  "*subtask21*"

 

it has to show the following results when I run my query/search

epic1   task1

epic1   subtask11

epic1   subtask12

epic2   task2

epic2   subtask21

it is understood that I am showing only 2 columns for the sake of illustration. there are obviously other fields that get returned when running a search. 

Please don't close this request unless you have a screenshot to show that your solution actually does what is being requested above.

Thanks.
fields.summary: viewing epic name for every single task/subtask  in the filter/search results

fields.description:
h3. Problem

At the moment it is not possible to create cascading fields on the team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects, only simple select lists.

h3. Suggested resolution

Add Select List (cascading) custom field to team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects.
fields.summary: Ability to create Select List (cascading) in team-managed (formerly next-gen) project

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
After implementing JSWCLOUD-17442 the option to drill down to stories was added to the roadmap but the ability to see the subtasks of those stories is not avaliable so at the moment hiding details useful to the roadmap view as you cannot see the subtask issue below the stories in the roadmap

h3. Suggested Solution
Enable seeing the child Subtasks alongside Epics and Stories in the roadmap for the full hierarchy visibility
fields.summary: Option to drill down to the Subtask level in the Roadmap
